result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie R Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 15-CF-44. Credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Jessie R Martin

from Waiver of Preliminary Hearing, Plea & Sentencing & Sentencing Hearing on Revocation dated 11/03/15.

Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, indicates defendant is ready to conclude matter today.

Defendant Jessie R Martin in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Jessie R Martin in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Jessie R Martin in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Jessie R Martin in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Jessie R Martin appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers, who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
